      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean add(Batch batch, Process process)
      The function add() adds the given process to this batch if it is not already present.

      The function addAll() adds all of the elements in the given collection to this batch if they're not already present.
      void addAllObjectsToIndex()
      Method adds all object found in database to Elastic Search index.
      boolean contains(Batch batch, CharSequence sequence)
      The function contains() returns true if the title (if set) or the id-based label contain the specified sequence of char values.

      Method necessary for get from database object by id.

      Find batches by id of process.

      Find batches with exact title and type.

      Find batch with exact title or type.
      List<SearchResult> findByType(Batch.Type type, boolean contains)
      Find batches with exact type.
      String getIdString(Batch batch)
      The function getIdString() returns the identifier for the batch as read-only property "idString".
      String getLabel(Batch batch)
      The function getLabel() returns a readable label for the batch, which is either its title, if defined, or, for batches not having a title (in recent versions of Production, batches didn’t support titles) its ancient label, consisting of the prefix “Batch ” (in the desired translation) together with its id number.
      String getTypeTranslated(Batch batch)
      Returns the translated batch type label.
      int hashCode()
      Kitodo does not keep objects around from Hibernate session to Hibernate session, so this is the working approach here.
      protected void manageDependenciesForIndex(Batch batch)
      Method saves processes related to modified batch.

      Search Batch objects by given query.

      Returns the number of processes in this batch.
      String toString(Batch batch)

      • findByType

        public List<SearchResult> findByType(Batch.Type type,
                                     boolean contains)
                              throws DataException
        Find batches with exact type. Necessary to assure that user pickup type from the list which contains enums.
        Parameters:
        type - of the searched batches
        Returns:
        list of search results with batches of exact type
        Throws:
        DataException

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Batch batch,
                        CharSequence sequence)
        The function contains() returns true if the title (if set) or the id-based label contain the specified sequence of char values.
        Parameters:
        sequence - the sequence to search for
        Returns:
        true if the title or label contain s, false otherwise

      • getIdString

        public String getIdString(Batch batch)
        The function getIdString() returns the identifier for the batch as read-only property "idString". This method is required by Faces which silently fails if you try to use the id Integer.
        Returns:
        the identifier for the batch as String

      • getLabel

        public String getLabel(Batch batch)
        The function getLabel() returns a readable label for the batch, which is either its title, if defined, or, for batches not having a title (in recent versions of Production, batches didn’t support titles) its ancient label, consisting of the prefix “Batch ” (in the desired translation) together with its id number.
        Returns:
        a readable label for the batch

      • getTypeTranslated

        public String getTypeTranslated(Batch batch)
        Returns the translated batch type label.
        Returns:
        the display label for the batch type

      • size

        public int size(Batch batch)
        Returns the number of processes in this batch. If this batch contains more than Integer.MAX_VALUE processes, returns Integer.MAX_VALUE.
        Returns:
        the number of elements in this batch
        See Also:
        Collection.size()

      • toString

        public String toString(Batch batch)
        The function toString() returns a concise but informative representation that is easy for a person to read and that "textually represents" this batch.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Kitodo does not keep objects around from Hibernate session to Hibernate session, so this is the working approach here.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object
        See Also:
        "https://developer.jboss.org/wiki/EqualsandHashCode"
